Company Name: Pamten Inc                                        Dec 22 – Present

Client: Hellenic Life Insurance Company, Cyprus
Environment: AWS, JIRA, OIPA (Oracle Insurance Policy Administrator)
Role: Sr. Business Analyst 
Project Description: Customer and Agent Service Portal Development
Hellenic Life Insurance Company built an online platform using AWS and OIPA (Oracle Insurance Policy 
Administrator) for its policy servicing which allowed Customers and Agents to process several 
transactions in their policies online.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Drive requirement sessions with the client around policy administration business processes, 
technical processes, and non-functional requirements
Translate insurance product requirements into business and functional requirements, and
translate insurance business processes, market practices, and other client business needs into 
specific software requirements
Work with the team leads and client Subject Matter Experts to identify and document solutions, 
define the project scope, project estimates and timelines

specific software requirements
Work with the team leads and client Subject Matter Experts to identify and document solutions, 
define the project scope, project estimates and timelines
Present and recommend solutions to clients that meet their business needs
Support the project manager and development team by owning the documentation of the detailed 
business requirements, sprint planning, backlog grooming, and identifying out of scope 
requirements and change requests
Without prejudice to the duties stated above, you will carry out such other instructions and orders 
as may be given to you by the Company from time to time.
Company Name: DXC Technology             Dec 16 – Sep 21
Business Analyst – Life Insurance Domain
Projects:
Client: Ameritas Life Insurance Corp, USA
Environment: WMA, JIRA
Role: Sr. Business Analyst 
Project Description: New Product Development
In this Project, Ameritas considered the WMA platform will be the base platform component for the

Environment: WMA, JIRA
Role: Sr. Business Analyst 
Project Description: New Product Development
In this Project, Ameritas considered the WMA platform will be the base platform component for the 
implementation of new products; namely, a term product, an equity annuity product and universal life 
equity product. These products will be implemented by the CSC implementation team and administered 
by the CSC Business Process Services (BPS) processing centers.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Involved in business analysis and project management, coordinating between the team members, 
addressing budget issues and creating test plans according to the business requirements. 
Company Name: Equisoft                                        Sep 21 – Dec 22

Performed GAP Analysis to analyze the current system and worked with internal users to help define 
system requirements.
Associated with documenting customization requirements, business rules and data migration 
prerequisites for the implementation of New Product issuance and Underwriting.
Utilized the guidelines and artefacts of the Agile Methodology to develop a detailed implementation 
process for New System (wmA) Integration during different iterations and phases in Software 
Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Writing Epics and user stories, managing sprints and backlog grooming, and tracking project 
progress in JIRA.
Expertise in performing Bug and Defect management using bug-tracking tool JIRA.
Maintained the Requirements Tractability Matrix (RTM) and performed Gap Analysis.
Involved in testing various types of life insurance products like Whole Life , Term Insurance, 
Universal Life
Worked on Scrum Methodology as well as on SDLC procedures in the implementation of scrum

Universal Life
Worked on Scrum Methodology as well as on SDLC procedures in the implementation of scrum 
ceremonies like Sprint planning, Daily Stand up, Sprint Review, Sprint Retrospective meetings. 
Conducting the meetings with the developers and ensuring there are no hindrance for the job and 
supporting them with the frequent call set up on the clarifications required by the team.
Facilitated JAD sessions with management, development team, users and other stakeholders to 
refine functional requirements. 
Involved in developing strategies with Quality Assurance group to implement Test Cases in Test 
manager for User Acceptance Testing. Helped in creating end user manuals and procedure manuals.
Collaborated with Quality Assurance Analyst in Automated and Manual Black box testing.  
Testing done at different test phases including integration test, and system test, User Acceptance 
Testing.

Collaborated with Quality Assurance Analyst in Automated and Manual Black box testing.  
Testing done at different test phases including integration test, and system test, User Acceptance 
Testing.
Successfully coached the development team in adoption of SCRUM as a process skeleton, so as to 
enable team deliver higher quality, higher value software faster thus, improving time to market. 
Client: Bright House Financial (BHF) – MetLife, USA 
Environment: WMA, JIRA,
Role: Business Analyst & Quality Analyst
Project Description: Customer Service Portal Development and Data Migration
This application has been built on DXC’s Life & Annuity insurance product Wealth Management 
Accelerator. Part of this, DXC took over all the Met Life policies (Annuity, UL & TRAD) and converted 
them to the latest WMA17 version. This is a track in the project where DXC converted 1.4 million 
MetLife Annuity policies from WMA10 to WMA17 along with the new features being asked by the client

them to the latest WMA17 version. This is a track in the project where DXC converted 1.4 million 
MetLife Annuity policies from WMA10 to WMA17 along with the new features being asked by the client 
and develop a website for the Customer support activities and Customer Support Representative works 
online in order to serve BHF customers.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Obtained a detailed knowledge of current business process involved in the project environment.
Worked extensively with the users and with different levels of management to identify 
requirements, business events and to develop functional specifications for the proposed system. 
Conducted analysis of business processes and requirements and identified technology enabled 
improvements. Used agile software development methodology.

Analysis of key data fields from the existing systems and how they relate to the required conversion 
data fields on the wmA System.
Translated business requirements into functional specifications for communication to technical 
team throughout various releases of the project. 
Interviewed SMEs (Subject Matter Experts), asking detailed questions and carefully recording the 
requirements in a format that could be reviewed and understood by both business people and 
technical people. 
Analyzed User Requirement Document, Business Requirement Document (BRD), Technical 
Requirement Specification and Functional Requirement Specification (FRS). 
Involved with all the phases of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodologies throughout 
the project life cycle. 
Served as a resource for analytical services utilizing SQL Server
Worked on UAT testing and took signoff from the business users
Document software defects, using a bug tracking system, and also report defects to software

Worked on UAT testing and took signoff from the business users
Document software defects, using a bug tracking system, and also report defects to software 
developers Involved in Planning, analyzing bugs, Execution and Bug Tracking. 
Involved in creating Process Flow diagrams, Use Case Diagrams, Class Diagrams and Interaction 
Diagrams by the team.
Documented functional specifications and test plan
Involved in creating data mapping documents to map the data fields, which assist the middleware 
team to route and parse interface messages between different applications 
Company Name: SBI Life Insurance Co. Ltd.Jan 07 -  Nov 16
Designation: Assistant Manager – Insurance Operations
Roles and Responsibilities:
1.    Assistant Manager- Policy Servicing & Underwriting
a.    In Charge - Policy Servicing:
Claims management 
Coordinating with the regional branches and follow up for Processing the policy 
servicing requests at branch level with in TAT

a.    In Charge - Policy Servicing:
Claims management 
Coordinating with the regional branches and follow up for Processing the policy 
servicing requests at branch level with in TAT
MIS controlling and tracker Maintenance
Processing Policy servicing activities like COA, Surrenders, Nominations, Claims 
at branch level.
Managing teams at different locations under the processing Centre and guide 
them in every aspect of their day-to-day routine.
CRM- Customer Relationship Management (Internal & External)
b.    In Charge- Underwriting:
Underwriting/ Risk Assessment new life policies 
Assessing non-medical profiles for new business
Maintaining a proper check for the AML/KYC guidelines
Handling complete service underwriting (Requests Pre/ post issuance)
Follow up with branches for any requirements raised 
Handling system related automation process
2.    Assistant Manager- Risk Management
a.    In Charge - Regional Risk Control Unit:

Conduct risk assessment of processes at Regional Branches/PCs and identify 
process gaps, if any by performing the branch visits for process /transaction 
reviews, investigations on claims and complaints received at the branch level.
Flag off exceptional transactions identified / concern areas relating to process 
deviations to the Risk Control Unit team at HO.
Conduct periodic surprise verification of NB proposals/ Claims requests / Payout 
requests on random basis at Branches/ PCs and record/report anomalies if any.
Co-ordination with RCU team at HO for incidents reported from the region.
Obtain updates on the implementation of the actionable arising out of above.
Control testing on process changes implemented.
Training on Incident reporting process (IRP) and creating Risk Awareness in the 
region.
b.    In Charge- Regional Information Security:
Conduct Information Security risk assessments of systems and processes and 
identify gaps.

region.
b.    In Charge- Regional Information Security:
Conduct Information Security risk assessments of systems and processes and 
identify gaps.
Understand the data flow at regional Branches /PCs/ROs and assess IS Risk.
Flag off exceptional IS risks or severe possible data loss issues to information 
security team /Risk control Unit
Information Security awareness training to end users of regional branches
c.In Charge- Regional Business Continuity Management:
Co-ordinate with the Regional Risk officers for monitoring incidents reported 
actionable.
